issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h6.Reproduce Steps:
1. Download the example code from [Appcelerator Lab|http://labs.appcelerator.com/project/55f74a9f421c44837717716b/Hyperloop-Module]
2. Import the example to studio.
3. install the Hyperloop module.
4. Run the app to device or emulator.
5. Tap back button to close the app, then re-open it.

h6.Actual Result
App hangs on the splash screen. 

h6.Expect Result
Should work well.
fields.summary: Android: Using Hyperloop module, App stuck on splash screen after closing and re-opening
fields.environment:
TI SDK 5.2.0.GA. 5.4.0.v20160407140729
Android Device: Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Android 4.2.2
Emulator: Genymotion emulator with Android 5.0.*
Hyperlopp module: 1.1.0 and 1.1.3

comments.body: Hey [~sliang], still occurring using latest 1.1.3 version? Please verify, thanks! Never experienced the issue.
[~hansknoechel]. Tested with Hyperloop Module 1.1.3 Beta with Ti SDK 5.4.0. Same problem occurs still.
I am unable to reproduce this myself with the latest hyperloop-example app running hyperloop v 1.2.0.

Unable to reproduce this issue, tested with the following environment; 
Pixel (7.1) 
MacOS 10.11.6 (15G31) 
Studio 4.8.1.201612050850 
Ti SDK 6.0.3 GA 
Appc NPM 4.2.8 
Appc CLI 6.1.0 
Ti CLI 5.0.11 
Alloy 1.9.5 
Arrow 1.10.1 
Xcode 8.2 (8C38) 
Node v4.6.0 
Java 1.7.0_80
